intro: Tetrapterys crispa subsp. typica, commonly known as the zigzag acanthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, zigzag-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to parts of Central and South America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
